get.description: Get campaigns bound to an organization Description: This method gets a list of campaigns bound to an organization The pattern is GET: api/config/organizations/{organizationId}/campaigns - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - organizationId: The organization id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - campaigns: A list of bound campaigns

Get organizations bound to a campaign Description: This method gets all organizations bound to a campaign The pattern is GET: api/config/campaigns/{campaignId}/organizations - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - campaignId: The campaign id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - organizations: A list of bound organizations

post.description: Bind a campaign to an organization Description: This method binds an organization to a campaign The pattern is POST: api/config/organizations/{organizationId}/campaigns/{campaignId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - campaignId: the campaign id - organizationId: the organization id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind an organization from a campaign Description: This method unbinds an organization from a campaign The pattern is DELETE: api/config/?campaigns/{campaignId}/organizations/{organizationId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - campaignId: The campaign id - organizationId: The organization id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

post.description: Bind organization to campaigns Description: This method binds an organization to many or to all campaigns If you pass a list of campign ids in the body, only the campaigns in the list will be bound to the organization If you don´t pass anything in the body, all campaigns will be bound to the organization The pattern is Post: api/config/campaigns/organizations/{organizationId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - organizationId: the organization is - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of campaigns id - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind an organization from campaigns Description: This method unbinds an organization from many or from all campaigns If you pass a list of campaigns ids in the body, only the campaign in the list will be unbound from the organization If you don´t pass anything in the body, all campaigns will be unbound from the organization The pattern is DELETE: api/config/campaigns/organizations/{organizationId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - organizationId: The organization id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of campaign Ids - Information received in the response BODY - None

post.description: Bind campaign to organizations Description: This method binds a campaign to many or to all organizations. If you pass a list of organization ids in the body, only the organizations in the list will be bound to the campaign If you don´t pass anything in the body, all organizations will be bound to the campaign The pattern is POST: api/config/organizations/campaigns/{campaignId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - campaignId: the campaign id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of organization Ids - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind a campaign from organizations Description: This method unbinds a campaign from many or from all organizations The pattern is DELETE: api/config/organizations/campaigns/{campaignId} If you pass a list of organization ids in the body, only the organizations in the list will be unbound from the campaign If you don´t pass anything in the body, all organizations will be unbound from the campaign - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - campaignId: The campaign id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - A list of organization ids *OPTIONAL - Information received in the response BODY - None

The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - pause plan: the pause plan object - Information received in the response BODY - pauseId: the id o the newly created pause plan

get.description: Get all pauses bound to a pause plan Description: This method gets all campaigns bound to a pause plan The pattern is GET: api/config/pauseplans/{pausePlanId}/pauses - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - pauses: A list of pauses

Get all pause plans bound to a pause Description: This method gets all campaigns bound to a pause plan The pattern is GET: api/config/pauses/{pauseId}/pauseplans - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pauseId: The pause id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - pausePlans: A list of pause plans

post.description: Bind a pause plan to an pause Description: This method binds a pause plan to an pause The pattern is GET: api/config/pauses/{pauseId}/pauseplans/{pausePlanId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - pauseId: The pause id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind a pause plan from a pause Description: This method unbinds a pause plan from a a pause The pattern is GET: api/config/pauses/{pauseId}/pauseplans/{pausePlanId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - pauseId: The pause id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

post.description: Bind an pause to pause plans Description: This method binds an pause to many or to all pause plans The pattern is GET: api/config/pauseplans/pauses/{pauseId}s - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of pause plan ids - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind an pause from pause plans Description: This method unbinds an pause from many or from all pause plans The pattern is GET: api/config/pauseplans/pauses/{pauseId}' - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pauseId: The pause id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of pause plan ids - Information received in the response BODY -

post.description: Bind a pause plan to pauses Description: This method binds a pause plan to many or to pause plan The pattern is GET: api/config/pauses/pauseplans/{pausePlanId - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - A list of pauses ids - Information received in the response BODY - None

delete.description: Unbind a pause plan from pauses Description: This method unbinds a pause plan from many or from all pauses The pattern is DELETE: api/config/pauses/pauseplans/{pausePlanId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pausePlanId: The pause plan id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY *OPTIONAL - A list of pause ids - Information received in the response BODY - None

get.description: Retrieves a pause object Description: This method retrieves a pause by a given id The pattern is GET: api/config/pauses/{pauseId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - organizationId: the organizatio id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - pause: the found Pause object

delete.description: Delete a Pause Description: This method receives a pause id and deletes the pause from the database The pattern is: DELETE: api/config/pauses/{pauseId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - pauseId: the pause id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

get.description: Retrieves all pauses from the tenant database Description: This method retrieves all pauses from a given tenant The pattern is: GET: api/config/pauses - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - pauses: a list of pauses in the given tenant

put.description: Update a Pause object Description: This endpoint receives a pause object and updates the database The pattern is PUT: api/config/pauses - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - pause: the pause object - Information received in the response BODY - None

post.description: Add a new Pause into the database Description: This method receives a pause object and adds it as a new registry into the database The pattern is: POST: api/config/pauses - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - pause: the pause object - Information received in the response BODY - pauseId: the id o the newly created pause

get.description: Get a city by Id Description: This method gets a city object by a given id. All cities are linked to a state The route is: GET api/config/place/cities/{cityId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - None - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - city: a city object

Get a state by Id Description: This method gets a state object by a given id. All states are linked to a country The route is: GET api/config/place/states/{stateId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - None - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - state: a state object

Get a country by Id Description: This method gets a country object by a given id. The route is: GET api/config/place/countries/{countryId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - None - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - country

Get a all countries Description: This method gets all countries existing in the database. The route is: GET api/config/place/countries - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - state: a state object

Get a all states of a country Description: This method gets all states of a given country. The route is: GET api/config/place/countries/{countryId}/states - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - None - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - states: a list of state objects

Get a all cities of a state Description: This method gets all cities of a given state. The route is: GET api/config/place/states/{stateId}/cities - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - None - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - CITIES: a list of CITIES objects

200.description: The API is up and running

get.description: Test if the API is up and running Description: Call this endpoint whenever you want to be sure that the config service is correctly running The route is: api/config/test - Security: no need to be logged in - No information needed in the request body - Information received in the response body - message: "Hello from OlosLive. The Config Service API is up and running."

Health Check by AWS Description: AWS Target Group call this endpoint to check the health of the service The route is: api/config/health - Security: no need to be logged in - No information needed in the request body - Information received in the response body - message: "OK"

Retrieves an user object Description: This method retrieves an user by a given id The pattern is GET: api/config/users/{userId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - organizationId: the organizatio id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - user: the found User object

delete.description: Delete a User Description: This method receives an user id and deletes the user from the database The pattern is: DELETE: api/config/users/{userId} - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Parameter needed in the URL - userId: the user id - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - None

get.description: Retrieves all users from the tenant database Description: This method retrieves all users from a given tenant The pattern is: GET: api/config/users - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - Information needed in the request BODY - None - Information received in the response BODY - users: a list of users in the given tenant

put.description: Update an User object Description: This endpoint receives an user object and updates the database The pattern is PUT: api/config/users - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - user: the user object - Information received in the response BODY - None

post.description: Add a new User into the database Description: This method receives an user object and adds it as a new registry into the database The pattern is: POST: api/config/users - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY - user: the user object - Information received in the response BODY - userId: the id o the newly created user

get.description: Gets the key name of the tenant´s identity provider broker Description: Once OlosLive doesn´t use password to authenticate the user, (this task is performed by the idp), the LoginService needs a unique key value to match to the credentials sent by the idp. The route is Post: api/login/idp - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authorization header with a valid Bearer access token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY: - idpName: Broker name (i.e.: 'firebase') - Information received in the response BODY - key_name: the new valid refresh_token

post.description: Retrieves a new pair of tokens: Access Token and RefreshToken Description: When the access token is to be expired, the client can ask for a new one. To do so, it has to sent the refresh token that was received in the last interaction with the LoginService. If both access and refresh tokens are valid, the Login service sends a new pair to the client with a new expiration time The route is POST: api/refresh_token - Security: The client must be logged. The request object must have an Authotization header with a Bearer token - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant id - Information needed in the request BODY: - id: user identification - refresh_token: the last received refresh_token - Information received in the response BODY - access_token: the new valid access token - refresh_token: the new valid refresh_token

get.description: Retrieves the identity provider linked to the tenant Description: When the user is entering the OlosLive, the login service has to tell the client what the right dialog box is for the uset types the credentials. To do it, the service uses the tenant's name given in the url and searchs the corresponding idp in database. The pattern is GET: api/login - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - Security: no need to be logged in - No information needed in the request BODY - Information received in the response BODY - id: tenant identification - provider: an object including the broker´s name and a list of identity providers

200.description: The API is up and running

get.description: Test if the Login API is up and running Description: Call this endpoint to be sure that the Login Service is correctly running The route is GET: api/login/test - Security: no need to be logged in - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - No information needed in the request BODY - Information received in the response BODY - message: "Hello from OlosLive. The Login Service API is up and running."

Health Check by AWS Description: AWS Target Group call this endpoint to check the health of the service - Security: no need to be logged in - No information needed in the request body - Information received in the response body - message: "OK"

post.description: Retrieves the user identification Description: After the successful process of getting the tenant id and the broker´s name, the client sends back to the LoginService the tenant id as well as the broker name. This is necessary to give the broker´s name because the client needs to know what key name the broker uses to uniquely identify the user. For example, Firebase uses the email for this purpose, but other brokers can use different key, like username or the company id The pattern is GET: api/login - Security: the client has to send the IdP access token to be verified - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - Authorization: the firebase token - Information needed in the request BODY - idpName: the identity provider broker unique name - Information received in the response BODY - id: user identification - status: a string with the user status (active or inactive) - refresh_token: a JWT token to be used by the client to ask for a new access token when it is about to be expired

200.description: The API is up and running

get.description: Test if the monitor API is up and running Description: Call this endpoint to be sure that the monitor Service is correctly running The route is GET: api/monitor/test - Security: no need to be logged in - Information needed in the request HEADER - tenantId: the tenant´s id - No information needed in the request BODY - Information received in the response BODY - message: "Hello from OlosLive. The monitor Service API is up and running."

Health Check by AWS Description: AWS Target Group call this endpoint to check the health of the service The route is: api/config/health - Security: no need to be logged in - No information needed in the request body - Information received in the response body - message: "OK"
